Caption: Sir C.V. Raman is escorted by Mr. C.V. Sethunathan, Prof. B. Sengupto and a police officer
Description: The third convocation of IIT Madras was held on the 30th of July, 1966. The convocation took place on a Saturday evening at the Instituteâ€™s Open Air Theater. The Chief Guest and speaker, at this historic event for the Institute, was none other than Sir C. V. Raman, the Indian Physicist and awardee of the Nobel Prize and Bharat Ratna, for his ground breaking works in the area of light scattering. On the day, upon reaching the campus, Dr. C. V. Raman was received by Prof. B. Sengupto (right), Director of the Institute, and Shri C.V. Sethunathan (left), Registrar.
